avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m, in the event of solar radiation in particular on rocky slopes.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in isolated cases by people on very steep shady slopes, in particular in the vicinity of peaks above approximately 2500 m. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare but are difficult to recognise.
There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. This applies in particular in the early morning.
avalancheActivity.highlights: More small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist snow slides and avalanches are possible. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released especially by large additional loads on shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. Adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: The conditions are spring-like.
In all altitude zones less snow than usual is lying.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack in particular on steep southeast, south and southwest facing slopes below approximately 2500 m.

tendency.comment: The weather conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Very early morning: There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
On very steep shady slopes the avalanches can be triggered in the old snow and reach medium size. This applies in particular in case of a large load.
As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m, caution is to be exercised in particular in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in some places by people on shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. In particular adjacent to ridgelines snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Individual weak layers exist in the top section of the snowpack on shady slopes.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: The conditions are spring-like. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day.
In all regions as well as in all altitude zones less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger is within the lower range of danger level 2 (moderate).

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day more mostly small moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m, in the event of solar radiation in particular on rocky slopes.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases by people on very steep shady slopes, in particular in the vicinity of peaks above approximately 2500 m. The avalanche prone locations are very rare but are difficult to recognise.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions. Moist snow slides and avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In the Prealps as well as at low altitude no snow is lying. Also along the border with France less snow than usual is lying.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack in particular on steep southeast, south and southwest facing slopes below approximately 2500 m.
In very isolated cases weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on steep shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Very early morning: In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
As a consequence of warming during the day more mostly small moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases by winter sport participants in particular on very steep shady slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack is largely stable. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to gradual softening of the snowpack below approximately 2500 m.
On sunny slopes as well as at low altitude no snow is lying. Also in high Alpine regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
